overview: The graduation work of female director Weisi Jian (简伟斯) at the American Film Institute. It discusses and describes women's moods and experiences with images, and then explains the impact of studying abroad on women's menstrual cycle, historical national identity, gender identity, and, indirectly, sexuality. In the early days of Taiwanese feminism, it could be called a big step for Taiwanese independent production female directors.
title: A Woman Waiting For Her Period
